title: [BEAM-6433] Clean up an untracked file generated by python doctest
body:
For now, running `./gradlew :beam-sdks-python:docs` leaves an untracked file called `myoutput-00000-of-00001`. This PR removes it when the test is finished. ------------------------ Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [x] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. This will automatically link the pull request to the issue. - [x] If this contribution is large, please file an Apache [Individual Contributor License Agreement](https://www.apache.org/licenses/icla.pdf). It will help us expedite review of your Pull Request if you tag someone (e.g. `@username`) to look at it. title: [BEAM-5009] Pin spotless and googleJavaFormat to latest; apply globally
body:
Our spotless plugin was just using the latest googleJavaFormat or whatever was on disk. So new devs would get a new version and our codebase would break, actually. This pins the version and also updates everything. ------------------------ Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [x] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. title: [BEAM-6418] Avoid Jenkins memory problems for Flink build targets
body:
The Jenkins test environment is very memory constraint. We get killed by the host OS (exit code 137) while running tests for multiple FlinkRunner versions (1.5/1.6/1.7) in parallel. Disabling tests for 1.7 did not fix the issue. Thus, I'm also disabling test execution for 1.6. Generally speaking, it seems to be a Jenkins problem because the test JVM can't acquire the max memory that it has been provided (currently set to max 4GB per parallel instance) without getting killed by the host OS. title: [BEAM-3608] Port shaded Guava to vendored Guava
body:
This PR replaces shaded private uses of Guava with vendored Guava. Instead of relocating and bundling in each jar we produce, Guava is relocated once and published, and everything depends on this artifact. The process by which I produced this PR, since hand-review is not easy via GitHub (maybe OK via Reviewable.io): - global search and replace of `compile library.java.guava` with `shadow library.java.vendored_guava_20_0` - global search and replace of `com.google.common` imports to add the `org.apache.vendor.guava.v20_0.` prefix - look for compile errors and revert them manually - huge surprise that this was sufficient; yay! Not all uses of Guava in our codebase are shaded private uses. Cassandra, Kinesis, Bigtable, and Calcite all use Guava on their essential public API surface. ------------------------ Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [x] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. This will automatically link the pull request to the issue. - [x] If this contribution is large, please file an Apache [Individual Contributor License Agreement](https://www.apache.org/licenses/icla.pdf). It will help us expedite review of your Pull Request if you tag someone (e.g. `@username`) to look at it. title: Deflake statesampler_test
body:
1. Add a dependency on Tenacity, a general-purpose retry library: https://github.com/jd/tenacity. 2. Make statesampler_test easier to configure and adjust it to reduce flakiness: make the fastest state last 1 second, or total test runtime to last 6 seconds, and retry once if the test fails. This should reduce flakiness below 1 in 100000. Alternative considered: keep current state duration, but retry 5 times. The alternative would be less sensitive to a potential change in statesampler that would result in real loss of precision in measurement. ------------------------ Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [ ] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. This will automatically link the pull request to the issue. - [ ] If this contribution is large, please file an Apache [Individual Contributor License Agreement](https://www.apache.org/licenses/icla.pdf). title: [BEAM-6408] Fix load test job
body:
This jenkins job timeouted because we used only 10 workers and set a default 2 hours timeout on jenkins. I increased both the timeout (to 4 hrs) and workers (to --maxNumWorkers=32). I'm unsure if those are the right values - they certainly do the job (no timeout) but is it ok to use 32 workers? ------------------------ Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [ ] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. title: In SdkComponents (portability support lib), use equality to compare Coders
body:
In SdkComponents, Coders (and other model pipeline concepts) get registered. Previously, identity was used to compare Coders, instead of Coder equals(). This leads to equivalent Coders being created leading to separate Coder ids and entries in the model pipeline proto etc. It also leads to Coders created during internal expansion of PTransforms (e.g. Combine.perKey()'s accumulatorCoder) appearing to be different (and getting a different id) than the equivalent Coder known when the model pipeline proto was computed. This PR switches to equals() to compare Coders, so that it's no longer a problem to create equivalent Coder representations. title: [BEAM-6405] Let PortableValidatesRunner tests run in EMBEDDED environment
body:
We have seen repeated OOM errors on the Jenkins machines. We could potentially reduce the number of parallel tests further but the test runtime is already about an hour. Using the EMBEDDED environment should give us less memory problems and faster test execution. Note that EMBEDDED makes sense for these tests because they are purely Java-based. title: [BEAM-6184] Enforce javadoc check on non-trivial public methods
body:
This PR includes: 1) Enforce javadoc checkstyle rules on public non-trivial (> 30Loc) methods. 2) added an exmaple of @SuppressWarnings("checkstyle:JavadocMethod") in BeamTableUtils.java 3) Removed a few compiler suppresses that no longer needed (and do not work with checkstyle's naming convention). In this PR the violations are shown as warnings, for following step, we could either a) keep them as warnings, and switch to error when all are addressed (either adding comment or suppress). b) change them into errors, and add explicit suppression rules to all violations. Contributors eliminate and chop off these violations over time. ------------------------ Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [X ] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. This will automatically link the pull request to the issue. - [ ] If this contribution is large, please file an Apache [Individual Contributor License Agreement](https://www.apache.org/licenses/icla.pdf). It will help us expedite review of your Pull Request if you tag someone (e.g. `@username`) to look at it. title: [BEAM-6326] Fix portable stateful processing with side input
body:
This adds support in the portable Flink Runner for stateful ParDo processing when side inputs are present. The processing would previously fail because operator state was not partitioned by key when the operator had been connected to the operator producing the side input. This is tested by ParDoTest#testBagStateSideInput. title: [BEAM-6396] Disables memory usage test
body:
Disable memory usage test since it fails on some platforms with urllib3 v1.24.1 After an update of urllib3 from 1.15.1 to 1.24.1 this test started to fail with about an 50% increase in memory. After my initial analysis through `objgraph` I have seen that there was an increase in amount of tuple's being used by the test which was proportional to `num_maps * num_elements`. title: [BEAM-6382] SamzaRunner: add an option to read configs using a user-defined factory
body:
We need an option to read configs from a factory which supports user-defined file format and will be used in Yarn to read configs in containers. By default this config factory is to read property file. Also clean up some previous code which has been resolved by latest Samza version. ------------------------ Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [ ] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. This will automatically link the pull request to the issue. - [ ] If this contribution is large, please file an Apache [Individual Contributor License Agreement](https://www.apache.org/licenses/icla.pdf). It will help us expedite review of your Pull Request if you tag someone (e.g. `@username`) to look at it. title: [BEAM-6388] Fix flaky AtomicInsertTest#testAtomicInsert
body:
The idea behind `AtomicInsertTest#testAtomicInsert` is to check what happens if inserts fail. The table is mocked in a way, that there is 60% probability for an insert to succeed. Therefore, approximately 20 attempts should be enough. However, after refactoring from setting backoff duration to cumulative duration it never worked as it was intended. I refactored the code to make it more robust. R: @chamikaramj ------------------------ Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [ ] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. title: [BEAM-6386] Add named variant of PTransform::compose()
body:

This PR adds a variant to allow specifying a name for the returned transform in the same way that `apply` can take an explicit name. ------------------------ Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [x] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. title: [BEAM-6280] Refactors Python portability tests to be multi-threaded aware
body:
The local_job_service.py module was too complex and had a number of multi-threaded issues. One of the issue was that the Get(Message|State)Stream methods did not guarantee the consumer would see all message/state transitions. Another issue was a data race between messages and state transitions. In the test the PortableRunner would try and wait for any last messages. However, there was a race between receiving the message and the PortableRunner waiting for a terminal state. What might have happened was a job transition into a terminal state and the consumer would not receive the message, failing the test. Note: I wasn't able to repro the bug on my local machine but did my best to zero in on any multi-threading issues. There may be follow-up PRs to fix the issue if it pops up again. ------------------------ Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [x] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. title: [BEAM-6024] Build and verify Python 3 container image with Gradle
body:
With this change, people can build Python 3 container image with single command:

`./gradlew :beam-sdks-python-container-py3:docker -Ppython3`

Changes are:

- `:beam-sdks-python:setupVirtualenv` will create a python 3 virtualenv instead of python 2 (by default) if `-Ppython3` is specified.
- Add validation of building Python 3 container to one of existing Jenkins PostCommit.

@tvalentyn

but otherwise just fills out enum values to expose the ZStandard support
that already exists in commons-compress.

title: [BEAM-6362] remove --info from gradle invocations
body:
This should significantly reduce Gradle output and Jenkins job log
sizes, by only logging WARN and above log entries from Java tests.

Logs for failed Java tests will still be available via `Test Result`
links on the Jenkins job.

Python should see no difference in logging verbosity.

Please see JIRA issue for plan of action.

------------------------

title: [BEAM-6361][BEAM-6364] fix user-metric-prefix checking in Flink portable metrics update
body:
two small follow-ups to #7183:
- [BEAM-6361](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/BEAM-6361): fix incorrect user-metric-prefix check
- [BEAM-6364](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/BEAM-6364): WARN instead of `throw` on as-yet-unsupported metrics types

They're each pretty small, and the tests of the latter depend on the former, so I put them both in this PR; let me know if it would be better if I split them out.

R: @ajamato 
R: @robertwb (we'd previously discussed the [BEAM-6364](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/BEAM-6364) portion of this in particular)

title: [BEAM-6357] Retry Datastore writes on ABORTED
body:
Adds ABORTED to the list of retried error codes.
This code has been seen when there is entity group contention:
`Error code: ABORTED. Message: too much contention on these datastore entities.`

title: [BEAM-6030] Split metrics related options out of PipelineOptions
body:
I chose to put all metrics related options in a single class (as native spark does) rather than extracting only sink options (in either one class or one per sink) because it would have seemed strange to separate sink class choice from its configuration.
R: @kennknowles

title: [BEAM-6350] Reuse PCollectionView when created in translators
body:
If for LeftJoin is used BroadcastHashJoinTranslator then from right side is created PCollectionView (as sideInput).

If we use right side in multiple joins then PCollectionView  is created multiple times which is not optimal behavior.
